meanings.definition: To create or use a simplified form of language, typically combining elements of different languages.
meanings.sent1: She pidginized her speech to help her friends understand her better.
meanings.sent2: The travelers pidginized their communication to bridge the language barrier.
meanings.sent3: The children pidginized their secret code to confuse their parents.
meanings.sent4: He pidginized his notes to make studying easier.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pidginized the lesson for the young students to grasp the concept.

meanings.definition: Having been altered or simplified for communication between speakers of different languages.
meanings.sent1: The pidginized signs helped tourists navigate the city easily.
meanings.sent2: The pidginized menu made it simple for international visitors to order food.
meanings.sent3: The pidginized map was a lifesaver for the lost travelers.
meanings.sent4: She wore a pidginized version of traditional clothing for the multicultural event.
meanings.sent5: The pidginized instructions were clear and easy to follow for everyone.
